The four kinds of overflowing merit, ove: When a mendicant enters and remains in a limitless immersion of heart while using a robe, the overflowing of merit for the donor is limitless.
When a mendicant enters and remains in a limitless immersion of heart while eating almsfood, the overflowing of merit for the donor is limitless.
When a mendicant enters and remains in a limitless immersion of heart while using lodgings, the overflowing of merit for the donor is limitless.
When a mendicant enters and remains in a limitless immersion of heart while using medicines and supplies for the sick, the overflowing of merit for the donor is limitless.
The reckoning of merit [an4.51:8.4]: It’s not easy to grasp how much merit they have by saying that this is the extent of their overflowing merit … that leads to happiness.
It’s simply reckoned as an incalculable, immeasurable, great mass of merit.
The analogy of the rivers and the ocean: Hosts of people use the rivers, and though the rivers are many, all reach the great deep, the boundless ocean, the cruel sea that’s home to precious gems.

In the same way, when a person gives food, drink, and clothes; and they’re a giver of beds, seats, and mats— the streams of merit reach that astute person, as the rivers bring their waters to the sea.
